physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Palpable thyroid nodule. Evidence of lymphocytic thyroiditis and multifocal medullary thyroid carcinoma (MTC) involving the left lobe, isthmus, and right lobe of the thyroid. 39 out of 44 lymph nodes showed evidence of metastatic disease.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Calcitonin level: 509 ng/l (509 pg/ml). Serum calcium: 2.225 mmol/l (8.9 mg/dl); normal range: 2.1 –2.55 mmol/l (8.4 –10.2 mg/dl).
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: No radiological evidence of recurrent or metastatic disease. Normal urinary excretion of catecholamines and metanephrines. No symptoms suggestive of excessive catecholamine production. Skeletal abnormalities including congenital bowing of the tibia, narrowed and laterally displaced femoral necks, and scoliosis.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Postoperative calcitonin level: 4 ng/l (4 pg/ml). Serum calcium: 2.175 mmol/l (8.7 mg/dl); normal range 2.1 –2.55 mmol/l (8.4 –10.2 mg/dl). Intact PTH: 31 ng/l (31 pg/ml); normal range 10 –65 ng/l (10 –65 pg/ml).
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient II-10 presented with an enlarged thyroid gland and a palpable nodule in the right thyroid lobe. Fine-needle aspiration consistent with colloid adenoma. Histopathological studies showed autoimmune thyroiditis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient II-10 underwent a total thyroidectomy and central compartment (level VI) lymphadenectomy, with pathological examination finding two foci of microscopic MTC and extensive C cell hyperplasia.
